snippet: China’s assertive moves raise doubts about its commitment to being a peaceful partner and strain its relationship with the United States.
abstract: Editorial expresses concern that increasingly powerful China under assertive leadership of Xi Jinping may prove too aggressive in world affairs and unwilling to engage sufficiently in diplomacy; holds that America must strike correct balance between building ties with China and firmly discouraging its bullying tactics.
lead_paragraph: China’s assertive moves raise doubts about its commitment to being a peaceful partner and strain its relationship with the United States.
